title: The Vigilant Pencil: Yousef Flores' Week of Heroism
summary: Yousef Flores, an 80-year-old superhero, uses his drawing and instructing skills to battle crime and solve mysteries over a week, culminating in a lesson learned about the power of wisdom and creativity.
summaryGerman: Yousef Flores, ein 80-jähriger Superheld, nutzt seine Fähigkeiten im Zeichnen und Unterrichten, um über eine Woche hinweg Verbrechen zu bekämpfen und Rätsel zu lösen, die mit einer Lektion über die Kraft von Weisheit und Kreativität enden.
summaryDutch: Yousef Flores, een 80-jarige superheld, gebruikt zijn vaardigheden in tekenen en onderwijzen om gedurende een week misdaad te bestrijden en mysteries op te lossen, eindigend met een les over de kracht van wijsheid en creativiteit.
summaryFrench: Yousef Flores, un super-héros de 80 ans, utilise ses compétences en dessin et en enseignement pour lutter contre le crime et résoudre des mystères tout au long d'une semaine, concluant avec une leçon sur le pouvoir de la sagesse et de la créativité.

story.text: The week begins with Yousef Flores giving an art class at the local community center, where he sketches out his plan to capture a street artist vandalizing historic buildings.
Yousef uses his drawings to track and predict the vandal's next moves. His plan starts to take shape as he involves his students in a neighborhood watch program.
Mid-week, unsettling clues about the vandal's identity suggest a deeper conspiracy. Yousef feels an eerie chill as he uncovers connections to a bigger scheme.
Determined, Yousef leads a stakeout based on his sketched maps, resulting in a close encounter with the vandal, but escapes narrowly.
With new evidence, Yousef unravels the truth, linking the vandalism to a corrupt city official. He sketches an incriminating portrait, shared with local authorities.
Triumphant, Yousef and his team expose the corruption. The community gathers to celebrate their peaceful neighborhood, restored thanks to their vigilance.
Reflecting on the week, Yousef continues his drawing class, now filled with eager students inspired by their role in justice, feeling peaceful and proud.

moral: Even the gentle art of drawing can be a powerful weapon against injustice.
